Issues.Title: fix(core): reset `tView` between tests in Ivy TestBed
Issues.Body:
`tView` that is stored on a component def contains information about directives and pipes that are available in the scope of this component. Patching component scope causes `tView` to be updated. Prior to this commit, the `tView` information was not restored/reset in case component class is not declared in the `declarations` field while calling `TestBed.configureTestingModule`, thus causing `tView` to be reused between tests (thus preserving scopes information between tests). This commit updates TestBed logic to preserve `tView` value before applying scope changes and reset it back to the previous state between tests.

Closes #38600.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(core): reset `tView` between tests in Ivy TestBed" (#38659)

Issues.Title: feat(dev-infra): tool for staging and publishing releases
Issues.Body:
Creates a tool for staging and publishing releases as per the
new branching and versioning that has been outlined in the following
document. The tool is intended to be used across the organization to
ensure consistent branching/versioning and labeling:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/197kVillDwx-RZtSVOBtPb4BBIAw0E9RT3q3v6DZkykU

The tool implements the actions as outlined in the following
initial plan: https://hackmd.io/2Le8leq0S6G_R5VEVTNK9A.

The implementation slightly divered in so far that it performs
staging and publishing together so that releasing is a single
convenient command. In case of errors for which re-running the
full command is not sufficient, we want to consider adding
recover functionality. e.g. when the staging completed, but the
actual NPM publishing aborted unexpectedly due to build errors.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(dev-infra): tool for staging and publishing releases" (#38656)

Issues.Title: Unsubscribing interval outside of fakeAsync call leads 1 periodic timer(s) still in the queue.
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/core/testing ### Is this a regression? Dunno ### Description If interval was created in one fakeAsync call and is unsubscribed in another (or without one) then test fails with `Error: 1 periodic timer(s) still in the queue.`. Same with unfinished timeout. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ```ts import { fakeAsync } from '@angular/core/testing'; import { interval, Subject } from 'rxjs'; import { takeUntil } from 'rxjs/operators'; describe('fakeAsync + interval', () => { const subscribeMock = jasmine.createSpy(); const interval$ = interval(1000); const destroyed = new Subject(); beforeEach(fakeAsync(() => { interval$.pipe(takeUntil(destroyed)).subscribe(subscribeMock); })); afterEach(() => { destroyed.next(); }); it('smth', () => { expect(subscribeMock).not.toHaveBeenCalled(); }); }); ``` Adding fakeAsync calls to afterEach/it don't help. It passes only like this ```ts it('smth', fakeAsync(() => { interval$.pipe(takeUntil(destroyed)).subscribe(subscribeMock); expect(1).toEqual(1); destroyed.next(); })); ``` (fakeAsync is used due to tick usage in real tests) ## üî• Exception or Error 

Error: 1 periodic timer(s) still in the queue
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

yarn run v1.16.0
$ ng version

 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/

Issues.Title: feat(zone.js): test zone.js packge with tgz
Issues.Body:
Zone.js 0.11.0 release an empty bundle, and now the npm_package tests all target
bazel rule `npm_package`, but not `npm_package.pack`, and these two rules may
generate different results, for example, Zone.js 0.11.0's issue is `package.json`
define files array which make the bundle only include the files in the files array.
So this PR install the zone.js package from the archive generated from `npm_package.pack` rule.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(zone.js): test zone.js packge with tgz" (#38649)

Issues.Title: bug(core): viewRef._viewContainerRef can leak memory (ViewRef, ViewContainerRef)
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages as the source of the bug? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> The issue is caused by package @angular/core


### Is this a regression?

This is a problem in Ivy and View Engine.


### Description

The `attachToViewContainerRef()` method of the `ViewRef` class is called whenever the `ViewRef` is attached to a `ViewContainerRef`, and this `ViewContainerRef` instance is assigned to `viewRef._viewContainerRef`.

https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/930eeaf177a4c277f437f42314605ff8dc56fc82/packages/core/src/render3/view_ref.ts#L284-L289

The **only** place where the `_viewContainerRef` property is cleared is when `viewRef.destroy()` is manually called.

https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/930eeaf177a4c277f437f42314605ff8dc56fc82/packages/core/src/render3/view_ref.ts#L75-L88

When `viewContainerRef.detach()` is used to detach a `ViewRef`, the `_viewContainerRef` property is still referencing the container from which it was detached. If this container should be destroyed (e.g. a `ViewContainerRef` of a component being destroyed), then the `_viewContainerRef` property will continue to hold a reference to the destroyed container, causing a memory leak (until the next time this `ViewRef` is attached to a different container).

----

Upon initial glance of the source code, I was not able to find a quick solution to this issue. I don't know if there is a way to access a `ViewRef` instance inside the node_manipulation `detachView()` function.

https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/930eeaf177a4c277f437f42314605ff8dc56fc82/packages/core/src/render3/node_manipulation.ts#L319

Essentially, there needs to be some type of `detachFromViewContainerRef()` method to complement the `attachToViewContainerRef()` method.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

[StackBlitz example](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ymlxv8?file=src%2Fapp%2Fapp.component.ts)
What's happening here:
1. Manually create an `EmbeddedViewRef`.
2. Manually create a dynamic component.
3. Attach the `EmbeddedViewRef` to the dynamic component's `ViewContainerRef`.
4. Detach the `EmbeddedViewRef`.
5. Destroy the dynamic component.

----

(Using Chrome DevTools)
- Load the StackBlitz example.
- Take heap snapshot before doing anything.
	- Search objects for `ViewContainerRef` and you'll find **two** instances.
- Click "create and attach" button.
- Take heap snapshot.
	- Search objects for `ViewContainerRef` and you'll find **three** instances.
- Click "detach and destroy" button.
- Take heap snapshot.
	- Search objects for `ViewContainerRef` and you'll find **three** instances.
	- MEMORY LEAK --> the third `ViewContainerRef` should be garbage collected, as there are no references to it being held in user code

Now uncomment line 35 in app.component.ts that manually clears the `_viewContainerRef` property on `ViewRef` detach:

```ts
// Manually clear the view ref's assigned previously assigned view container
// --> Allows the `viewContainerRef` to be garbage collected.
(this.viewRef as any)._viewContainerRef = null;
```

Do the same steps as above.
After clicking on "detach and destroy", there will only be **two** `ViewContainerRef` instances which is expected behavior.


## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**
10.0.14
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(core): viewRef._viewContainerRef can leak memory (ViewRef, ViewContainerRef)" (#38648)

Issues.Title: fix(compiler-cli): output source-mappings for localized strings
Issues.Body:
Previously, localized strings had very limited or incorrect source-mapping
information available.

Now the i18n AST nodes and related output AST nodes include source-span
information about message-parts and placeholders - including closing tag
placeholders.

This information is then used when generating the final localized string
ASTs to ensure that the correct source-mapping is rendered.

See #38588 (comment)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(compiler-cli): output source-mappings for localized strings" (#38645)

Issues.Title: Can't type in Angular form text/password/number input field
Issues.Body:
I already wrote on [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/63599715/cant-type-in-angular-form-text-password-number-input-field) but I' not receiving any answer, I thought to post it here, as well. FOR THE CODE BLOCKS, PLEASE REFER TO STACK OVERFLOW.

I am developing a site using Angular 9. I am also using Angular Material and MDBootstrap for the styling (https://mdbootstrap.com/). When I try to type something in a text/password/number input field inside one of my forms, it doesn't write anything and the field doesn't seem to receive the input; also, the variable I bound the field to is not updated with the new value. What makes it weirder is that:

- I can select the input field (it gets highlighted as if I can start typing)

- I can do CTRL+C on the field and what I copied somewhere else is pasted, as expected

- I can use the type="number" arrow selectors to set the value of the field

- I cannot type from the keyboard in the fields

- I can interact as expected with other form tags, such as <select>

- If I reload the page, it usually starts working as expected and I can type into the fields
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can't type in Angular form text/password/number input field" (#38635)

        }
    },
    module: {
        rules: [
            {
                test: /(?:\.ngfactory\.js|\.ngstyle\.js|\.ts)$/,
                loader: '@ngtools/webpack'
            },
            {
                test: /\.html$/,
                use: "raw-loader",
            },
            {
                test: /\.css$/,
                include: path.resolve(__dirname, "wwwroot/ClientApp"),
                use: "raw-loader"
            },
            {
                test: /\.css$/,
                exclude: path.resolve(__dirname, "wwwroot/ClientApp"),
                use: [MiniCssExtractPlugin.loader, "css-loader"]
            },
            {
                test: /\.scss$/,
                include: path.resolve(__dirname, "wwwroot/ClientApp"),
                use: ["raw-loader", {
                    loader: "sass-loader", options: {
                        includePaths: [path.resolve(__dirname, "wwwroot/styles")]
                    }
                }]
            },
            {
                test: /\.scss$/,
                exclude: path.resolve(__dirname, "wwwroot/ClientApp"),
                use: [MiniCssExtractPlugin.loader, "css-loader", "sass-loader"]
            }
        ]
    },
    resolve: {
        extensions: [".tsx", ".ts", ".js"]
    },
    plugins: [
        new AngularCompilerPlugin({
            tsConfigPath: 'wwwroot/ClientApp/tsconfig.json',
            entryModule: 'wwwroot/ClientApp/app/app.module#AppModule',
            sourceMap: false
        }),
        new CleanWebpackPlugin(["dist/*.js"], { verbose: true }),
        new MiniCssExtractPlugin({
            filename: "[name].css",
            chunkFilename: "[id].css"
        }),
        //new BundleAnalyzerPlugin()
    ],
    output: {
        path: path.resolve(__dirname, "wwwroot/dist"),
        filename: "[name].min.js"
    },
};
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Getting Errors Maximum call stack size exceeded intermittently in angular 8 based application in IPhone X for safary and chrome" (#38633)

Issues.Title: Script to update all golden files at once

# üöÄ feature request

### Description

When working on `core` changes, sometimes you will need to update multiple golden files. It would be great to have a script that allows you to update all golden files at once without going through them one at a time.

Issues.Title: ng build --watch build all bundles instead delta bundle
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes ng build --watch should produce only delta bundle, and not build the whole project on any change. ### Description when using ng build --watch flag, I expect the behavior to be as same as it was in previous version: If the main code changed, the build --watch should produce only new main.js bundle, if the styles changed, should produce new styles.js bundle. Actual - the ng build --watch produce all bundles in each change (change on main/styles etc.) ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Title: hmr not working
Issues.Body:
Why can such a problem exist for so long and cannot be solved?

I haven't got HMR to work normally since angular 4

The steps to reproduce are simple

1. You only need to create a new project, `ng new test`
2. Change the script in package.json: `"start": "ng serve"` to `"start":"ng serve --hmr"`
3. Run `npm start`
4. Change the content in app.component.html and observe whether hmr takes effect in the developer tools
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "hmr not working" (#18649)

Issues.Title: Angular 7>10 image url conversion changed
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are effected by this bug? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->

- [ ] new
- [x ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc


### Description

Upon upgrading from angular 7 to 10,
The build process doesn't convert image urls to  inline base64 anymore.
That's really not a problem if the default now is to the image url stay as is, but the documentation doesn't show any option in angular.json / ng build flags to turn this feature on again.

Example:

`body.login-page:not(.dashboard-pages) {
    background-image: url(/images/atc-crowd.png) <- This one to base64;
    background-position: center;
    background-repeat: no-repeat;
    background-attachment: fixed;
    background-size: cover;
    width: 650px;
    margin: 7% auto;

}`

This feature is really important to us and hold the angular upgrade, hope there's a configuration to enable this again.

Thanks



## üåç Your Environment
Angular cli 10.0.6
Angular/core 10.0.6
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular 7>10 image url conversion changed" (#18648)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): ask to use a new port if in use
Issues.Body:
The dev-server builder will now ask the user if an available port can be used when a specified port is already in use.  If the user answers in the affirmative, an available port will be used instead.  Otherwise, the serve operation will fail.  If the terminal is not interactive (for example, CI), the serve operation will fail directly in the event of an already in use port.

Closes #18638

Issues.Title: Find available port when running ng serve instead of asking the user to specify it manually
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update

- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version

### Description
When running `ng serve` for a second project it should use the next available port instead of throwing an error. Eg: 4201

If I run `ng serve` and port 4200 is being used I expect the command to be smart enough to try the next available port until successful. Eg: 4201, 4202, etc

### Describe alternatives you've considered
This feature is available in all these: Stencil, React and Vue.

Issues.Title: perf(cdk/testing): allow batching of change detection
Issues.Body:
This PR introduces a new API for batching change detection across multiple harness operations. It will run change detection once at the beginning and once at the end of the batch rather than before every read from an element and after every interaction. This results in significant performance gains in some circumstances. For example:
- finding a button by text on a page with 100 buttons: 1250.7ms => 131.8ms (89% improvement)
- clicking 1000 buttons: 3009.8ms => 757.8ms (75% improvement)

Open questions:
- What should we call the method? `batchCD` is just intended as a placeholder name
- I think this function will often be used together with `Promise.all`, should we create a shortcut method for that, e.g. `harness.parallel(() => ...)` === `harness.batchCD(() => Promise.all(() => ...))`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(cdk/testing): allow batching of change detection" (#20464)

BREAKING CHANGES:

Issues.Title: feat(cdk-experimental/menu): add smart aim functionality to the menu
Issues.Body:
Implement Smart Aim which ensures that when a user is mousing through menus, the target
submenu the user is mousing into isn't closed prematurely. Currently, a user must perform precise
and deliberate mouse moves in order to avoid sibling trigger items which close the target submenu
the user is intending to go into.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(cdk-experimental/menu): add smart aim functionality to the menu" (#20442)

Issues.Title: perf(cdk/testing): Improve performance of clicking in unit tests.
Issues.Body:
This PR changes the semantics of `TestElement.click()` when called with
no arguments. Rather than guarantee clicking the center of the element,
the location of the click will be up to the particular
`HarnessEnvironment`. This allows the `TestbedHarnessEnvironment` to
skip the expensive and often unnecessary calculation to determine the
center of the element.

To replace the old behavior of `TestElement.click()`, the PR adds a new
signature, `TestElement.click('center')` that can be used to click the
center of the element. Calling `TestElement.click(x, y)` to click a
point relative to the top left of the element remains unchanged.

I tested the performance gain of these changes by running a unit test to
click 1000 buttons. Prior to this change it took 3000.2ms, with this
change it took 1842.1ms (38.6% improvement).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(cdk/testing): Improve performance of clicking in unit tests." (#20441)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-datepicker): tab index not being set on datepicker toggle
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction


Steps to reproduce:
1. Setup a mat-datepicker:

    <mat-form-fieldclass="date-input" >
      <input matInput [matDatepicker]="datePick"
        ngDefaultControl
        tabindex="{{tabindex}}
        formControlName="date"
      />
      <mat-datepicker tabindex="{{ 1 + tabindex}}" ></mat-datepicker>
      <mat-datepicker-toggle
      matSuffix
      [for]="datePick"
      ></mat-datepicker-toggle>
    </mat-form-field>


2. Put tabindex='1' on input and tabindex='2' on mat-datepicker.
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see? Tabs onto datepicker input and then tabs onto the calender icon.

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see? Tabs onto input and off.


#### Environment

- Angular: 10
- CDK/Material: 10.1.2
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(mat-datepicker): tab index not being set on datepicker toggle" (#20440)
